titlestmt.subtitle: Papers and Correspondence, 1923-1975, of Charles Ralph Boxer at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

did.head: Summary Information
did.unittitle: Boxer mss.,

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: ca. 3,500 items (incl. 147 photographs and negatives) items

did.abstract: Papers of Charles Ralph Boxer, 1904-2000, colonial historian, include drafts of many of his books and articles, reviews, lecture notes, miscellaneous teaching materials and miscellaneous biographical materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
One file closed to researchers. This file is marked Restricted in the finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Historian and professor of history at University of London, Yale University, and Indiana University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement/Organization
arrangement.p: Organized in six series: I. Correspondence, II. Writings, III. Academic Awards, IV. Conference Materials, V. Research Notes, VI. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Boxer mss., 1923-1975, consist of the correspondence and papers of Charles Ralph Boxer, 1904-2000, colonial historian, include drafts of many of his books and articles, reviews which concern the topics of the Catholic Church in Asia, the Dutch and Portuguese in Asia and Brazil, and the history and condition of women. Lecture notes, reviews of Boxer's works, writings by other scholars, student papers, miscellaneous teaching materials, academic awards, conference materials, and research notes and transcriptions are present. A section of miscellaneous materials includes bibliographies, clippings, illustrations, photographs, publisher's announcements, royalty statements, and contracts.
Manuscripts index in the Lilly Library includes entries at the item level.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Boxer mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, 1923-1975

scopecontent.p: The correspondence primarily concerns Boxer's academic research and career.

did.unittitle: Among the correspondents represented in the collection are:

did.unittitle: Writings
Boxer, Charles R.
The Action between Pater and Oquendo, 12 September 1631. Mariner's Mirror 45, no. 3 (July 1959): 179-199.
Admiral de Ruyter through English Eyes, 1607-1676. A revision of De Ruyter through English Eyes. Britain and Holland, the Official Organ of the Anglo-Netherlands Society 9, no. 2, p. 59-64.

[With Bernard Philippe Groslier] Angkor et le Cambodge au XVIe Siecle d'Apres les Sources Portugais et Espagnoles avec la collaboration de C. R. Boxer. Paris: Presses Universitaires de France, 1958. (Annales du Musee Guimet, Bibliotheque d'etudes, tome 63.)
The Anglo-Dutch Wars of the 17th century, 1652-1674. London, 1974(i.e. 1975) (for the National Maritime Museum).

Antonio Bocarro and the 'Livro do Estado da India Oriental': A bio-bibliographical note. Garcia de Orta, revista da Junta das Missoes Geograficas e de Investigacoes do Ultramar Lisbon, Numero especial (1956): 203-219.
Begin ende Voortgangh. Introduction by CRB.
Brazil at the Dawn of the 18th Century. Translation of Joao Antonio Andreoni's Cultura e opulencia do Brasil. Unpublished 1964.
Brazilian Gold and British Traders in the First Half of the Eighteenth Century. Reprinted from The Hispanic American Historical Review 49, no. 3 (August 1969).
Camoes and Couto: Two Comrades in Arms and in Letters. Later translated and published as Camoes e Diogo do Couto: irmaos em armas e nas letras. Occidente Lisbon, Numero especial (Nov. 1972): 25-37.
Carreira da India (Ships, men, cargoes, voyages). O Centro de Estudio Historicos Ultramarinos e as Comemoracoes Henriquinas. Lisbon, p. 33-82.
The Church Militant and Iberian Expansion, 1440-1770. Baltimore & London: The Johns Hopkins University Press, 1978.
The Commercial Letter-book of a Luso-Brazilian Merchant, 1646-1654. Boletin de Estudios Latinoamericanos y del Caribe Amsterdam, no. 18 (June 1975).
De Ruyter en de Englese oorlogen in de Gouden Eeuw. Bossum: De Boer Maritiem, 1976.
Dom Jorge de Meneses Baroche and the Battle of Mullenyawa, 1560. In Mare Luso-Indicum III (Societe d'Histoire de l'Orient, Paris, 1976), p. 85-97.
The Dutch Seaborne Empire, 1600-1800. London: Hutchinson, 1965.
European Missionaries and Chinese Clergy, 1658-1800. In M. N. Pearson, et al. The Age of Partnership, Essays in honour of Holden Furber Hawaii: University of Hawaii, 1979.
Faith and Empire: The Cross and the Crown in Portuguese Expansion, 15th-18th Centuries. Terrae Incognitae 8, Amsterdam, (1976): 73-89.
For Love of Gain. The Voyages of the Dutch East-Indiamen. Hemisphere, An Asian-Australian Magazine Woden, A. C. T., 23, no. 3 (May/June 1979): 130-137.
Francisco Vieira de Figueiredo: a Portuguese Merchant-adventurer in South East Asia, 1624-1667. The Hague: M. Nijhoff, 1967.
Friar Juan Pobre of Zamora and his Lost and Found 'Ystoria' of 1598-1603. Indiana University Bookman Bloomington Indiana, no. 10 (Nov. 1969): 24-26.
The Golden Age of Brazil, 1695-1750: Growing Pains of a Colonial Society. Berkeley and Los Angeles: University of California Press, 1962.
The Great Ship from Amacon: Annals of Macao and the old Japan Trade, 1555-1648. Lisbon: Centro de Estudos Historicos Ultramarinos, 1959.
Jan Compagnie in Oorlog en Vrede, Beknopt Geshiedenis van de VOC. Bossum: De Boer Maritiem, 1977.
Jan Compagnie in War and Peace, 1602-1799. Hong Kong: Heineman Asia, 1979.
Jorge d'Albuquerque Coelho: A Luso-Brazilian hero of the sea. Luso-Brazilian Review 6, no. 1 (June 1969): 3-17.

note.p: Notes, background materials, photos and negatives, draft.
